channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The vehicle is abundant in a dangerous position that is a H& S risk, 19th November
item.description:
The vehicle is abundant in a dangerous position that is a H& S risk. We now have two vehicle abandon in the same location. There is a huge H&S risk of an accident happening and people using this area as a dump site for abandon vehicles. The council needs to remove these vehicle asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 19th November
item.description:
Customer reporting that the timing on the lights appears to be malfunctioning - traffic waiting in Westfield Road has ~5 cycles of green lights before traffic on Ermin Street/Hucclcote Road is allowed to go for a few cars at a time. Heavy traffic build up
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Traffic lights causing gridlock every morning, 19th November
item.description:
The timings of the temporary traffic lights on Shurdington Road is causing gridlock every morning. They are left open on green for far too long, the traffic going towards cheltenham gets stuck at the Moorend park road lights and block the vehicles going the other way. That in turns blocks the traffic on Woodlands road to turn either way causing long queues. This morning was absolutely mayhem, cars going on pavements and wrong way around the vehicles blocked in lanes. This needs to be sorted, it has been going on for far too long and nothing is being done about it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Electrical items dumped in Manor Road, Swindon Village, 19th November
item.description:
Maybe if the Amenity Waste Centre in Swindon Road was still open, the person who dumped this electrical stuff in Manor Road would have driven half a mile further and disposed of this rubbish sensibly. There has noticeably been more flipping in our Village since the closure.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Manor Court, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Flytipping (possible offender details in bags and/or boxes) problem has been found, 19th November
item.description:
A Flytipping (possible offender details in bags and/or boxes) problem. This has been there since Saturday and is building up, more has been fly tipped since. This is opposite the Sainsbury's delivery depot, next to the shop. This is very dangerous and a well used road for dog walkers, runners and people shopping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old permit parking bay still being used, 19th November
item.description:
An old parking bay is still being used. The bay did have the original white road markings painted over in black but this black paint is now wearing off and vehicles are starting to use the bay again. The bay was originally removed due to a redesign of Zone15. Because vehicles are parking in this old bay again it is causing an obstruction to nearby residents when leaving their driveways. It is also causing a dangerous chicane / bottleneck on All Saints Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
